text:
July 11, 2023—KB5028186 (OS Build 10240.20048) - Microsoft Support 
 
 
July 11, 2023—KB5028186 (OS Build 10240.20048) 
Windows 10 
More... 
Less 
You’re invited to try Microsoft 365 for free 
Unlock now 
Release Date: 
7/11/2023 
Version: 
OS Build 10240.20048 
12/8/20 
For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update affects the Desktop Window Manager (DWM). It improves its reliability. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
July 2023 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5023787 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
. 
Install this update

.

title: July 11, 2023—KB5028186 (OS Build 10240.20048) - Microsoft Support
summary:
KB5028186 is a critical quality update released on July 11, 2023, that addresses reliability issues within the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) for Windows 10 (OS Build 10240.20048). The update includes enhancements that improve the overall reliability of the operating system but does not address any specific vulnerabilities or critical security issues. It is crucial to install the latest servicing stack update (SSU), KB5023787, prior to applying this cumulative update to avoid potential installation issues. Installation can be performed automatically via Windows Update or obtained through the Microsoft Update Catalog for standalone deployment.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- This update does not address any new vulnerabilities or critical security exploits; however, it ensures enhanced reliability of the existing system components.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- **Prerequisites**: 
    - Install SSU KB5023787 before applying this cumulative update.
- **Update Channels**:
    - **Windows Update and Microsoft Update**: Automatically downloads and installs without user intervention.
    - **Windows Update for Business**: Follows configured policies; automatic download and installation.
    - **Microsoft Update Catalog**: Download standalone package manually.
    - **Windows Server Update Services (WSUS)**: Ensure Products as "Windows 10" and Classifications as "Security Updates" are configured for automatic sync.

**Commands for Installation**:
If performing a manual installation via command line, use:
```
[Powershell]
```powershell
Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "/i KB5028186.msu /quiet /norestart"
```

**Known Issues**:
- Microsoft is currently unaware of any issues with this update.

This update emphasizes the need for maintaining up-to-date servicing stack updates to ensure the reliability and stability of the Windows operating system during the update process.
